data.title: Efficient and Flexible Hierarchical Data Layouts for a Unified Encoding of Scalar Field Precision and Resolution
data.authors: Duong Hoang;Brian Summa;Harsh Bhatia;Peter Lindstrom;Pavol Klacansky;William Usher;Peer-Timo Bremer;Valerio Pascucci
data.affiliation: Hoang, D (Corresponding Author), Univ Utah, SCI Inst, Salt Lake City, UT 84112 USA. Hoang, Duong; Klacansky, Pavol; Usher, Will; Pascucci, Valerio, Univ Utah, SCI Inst, Salt Lake City, UT 84112 USA. Summa, Brian, Tulane Univ, New Orleans, LA 70118 USA. Bhatia, Harsh; Lindstrom, Peter; Bremer, Peer-Timo, Lawrence Livermore Natl Lab, Ctr Appl Sci Comp, Livermore, CA USA.
data.abstract: To address the problem of ever-growing scientific data sizes making data movement a major hindrance to analysis, we introduce a novel encoding for scalar fields: a unified tree of resolution and precision, specifically constructed so that valid cuts correspond to sensible approximations of the original field in the precision-resolution space. Furthermore, we introduce a highly flexible encoding of such trees that forms a parameterized family of data hierarchies. We discuss how different parameter choices lead to different trade-offs in practice, and show how specific choices result in known data representation schemes such as zfp [52], idx [58], and jpeg2000 [76]. Finally, we provide system-level details and empirical evidence on how such hierarchies facilitate common approximate queries with minimal data movement and time, using real-world data sets ranging from a few gigabytes to nearly a terabyte in size. Experiments suggest that our new strategy of combining reductions in resolution and precision is competitive with state-of-the-art compression techniques with respect to data quality, while being significantly more flexible and orders of magnitude faster, and requiring significantly reduced resources.
data.keywords: scalar field,large-scale data,data compression,multiresolution,wavelet transform,coarse approximation
